goals.1: Identify the BGP for obtaining important attributes for people, e.g., date of birth/death, gender, profession
goals.2: Identify the BGP to retrieve countries with  had at least once had a president
goals.3: When was the first president of each country born? How many presidents each country had?
goals.4: Is there a country that had at some point a woman as a president?
goals.5: Analyze the number of presidents per country through time
goals.5.1: What are the top-5 countries for number of presidents? Which countries had the least?
goals.5.2: For how many presidents we know a date of death in each country?
goals.5.3: Which are the professions of different presidents? How many presidents had a specific profession?

search_workflow.narrative: start your workflow here
search_workflow.query: SELECT COUNT(*) WHERE { ?p wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 . }

search_workflow.narrative:
1. Identify the BGP for obtaining important attributes for people, e.g., date of birth/death, gender, profession
Find all the presidents
search_workflow.query: SELECT ?president ?presidentname WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative: find president instance of ... to select human president
search_workflow.query: SELECT ?president ?presidentname ?s ?sname WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P31 ?s . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . ?s <http://schema.org/name> ?sname . } LIMIT 20

search_workflow.narrative:
Look above I notice that there are a lot of president instance of 'fictional human' or 'comics character' or 'film character'
I think it's better to 'delete' these president, to investigate better.
GET: wd:Q5 --> humman
Find attributes for presidents
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pname WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 ; ?p ?o . ?p <http://schema.org/name> ?pname . } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative: Look for date of birthday/death
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pname WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 ; ?p ?o . ?p <http://schema.org/name> ?pname . FILTER(REGEX(?pname, "date")) } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative:
GET:
date of birth --> wdt:P569
date of death --> wdt:P570
Look for gender
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pname WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 ; ?p ?o . ?p <http://schema.org/name> ?pname . FILTER(REGEX(?pname, "gender")) } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative:
GET:
sex or gender --> wdt:P21
Look for occupation
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?p ?pname WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 ; ?p ?o . ?p <http://schema.org/name> ?pname . FILTER(REGEX(?pname, "occupation")) } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative:
GET:
occupation --> wdt:P106
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?president ?presidentname ?dateofbirth ?dateofdeath ?sexorgender ?occupation WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 . OPTIONAL { ?president wdt:P569 ?dateofbirth ; wdt:P570 ?dateofdeath ; wdt:P21 ?sex ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; wdt:P106 ?oc } . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . ?sex <http://schema.org/name> ?sexorgender . ?oc <http://schema.org/name> ?occupation . FILTER REGEX(?presidentname, "Napolita") } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative:
I want to find all president alive
I think to find italian presidents to see their attributes.. for example 'Napolitano'
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?president ?presidentname ?dateofbirth ?dateofdeath ?sexorgender ?occupation WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 . OPTIONAL { ?president wdt:P569 ?dateofbirth ; wdt:P570 ?dateofdeath ; wdt:P21 ?sex ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; wdt:P106 ?oc } . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . ?sex <http://schema.org/name> ?sexorgender . ?oc <http://schema.org/name> ?occupation . FILTER REGEX(?presidentname, "Napolita") } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative:
Looking above I notice that the query to find  'Napolitano' president it's wrong beacuse this BGP gives me
only death presidents.. so I have to change it...
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?president ?presidentname ?dateofbirth ?dateofdeath ?sexorgender ?occupation WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 . OPTIONAL { ?president wdt:P569 ?dateofbirth ; wdt:P21 ?sex ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; wdt:P106 ?oc } . OPTIONAL { ?president wdt:P570 ?dateofdeath } . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . ?sex <http://schema.org/name> ?sexorgender . ?oc <http://schema.org/name> ?occupation . } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative:
Now it works!
I try to find now 'Napolitano'
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?president ?presidentname ?dateofbirth ?dateofdeath ?sexorgender ?occupation WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 . OPTIONAL { ?president wdt:P569 ?dateofbirth ; wdt:P21 ?sex ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; wdt:P106 ?oc } . OPTIONAL { ?president wdt:P570 ?dateofdeath } . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . ?sex <http://schema.org/name> ?sexorgender . ?oc <http://schema.org/name> ?occupation . FILTER REGEX(?presidentname, "Napolita") } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative:
2. Identify the BGP to retrieve countries with had at least once had a president
We can start finding all the republics
search_workflow.query: SELECT ?rc ?republicountry WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . } LIMIT 5
output: President of the Republic of Poland

search_workflow.narrative: Each republic is linked to a Country.. so i find it
search_workflow.query: SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } LIMIT 5

search_workflow.narrative:
I look for the presidents of each country counting it
In this way I have all the republic of the world from 1 president to x
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?rcountry ?countryname (count(?pr) as ?num_president) WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . { SELECT ?rc ?country WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . } } ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?rcountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } ORDER BY ASC (?num_president) LIMIT 20
output: President of the Republic of Puerto Rico
President of the Republic of Kosova
President of the Republic of Namibia
Great President of the Republic of China
President of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic

search_workflow.narrative:
3. When was the first president of each country born? How many presidents each country had?
Analyzing the first question, we can start finding all the republics
search_workflow.query: SELECT ?rc ?republicountry WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . } LIMIT 5
output: President of the Republic of Poland

search_workflow.narrative: Each republic is linked to a Country.. so i find it
search_workflow.query: SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } LIMIT 5
output: President of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic

search_workflow.narrative:
Now to find first president born for each country, I look for the presidents of each country and his dateofbirth
(using IRI wdt:P569 found above in the Section 1)
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname ?dateofbirth WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . OPTIONAL { ?pr wdt:P569 ?dateofbirth } . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } ORDER BY (?dateofbirth) LIMIT 20
output: President of the Federal Republic of Central America
President of the Republic of Poland
President of the Republic of Guatemala
President of the Federal Republic of Central America

search_workflow.narrative: Now I look for the first president for each country, selecting the min date of birth for each country
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?republicountry ?countryname (min(?dateofbirth) as ?dbirth) WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P569 ?dateofbirth ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } } GROUP BY ?republicountry ?countryname LIMIT 10
output: President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo

search_workflow.narrative: I find how many presidents has each country
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?republicountry ?countryname count(distinct ?pr) WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } } GROUP BY ?republicountry ?countryname LIMIT 10
output: President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo

search_workflow.narrative: When was the first president of each country born? How many presidents each country had?
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?republicountry ?countryname (count(?pr) as ?numpresidents) (min(?dateofbirth) as ?datebirth_first_president) WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P569 ?dateofbirth ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } } GROUP BY ?republicountry ?countryname LIMIT 10
output: President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo

search_workflow.narrative:
4. Is there a country that had at some point a woman as a president?
GET from above:
sex or gender --> wdt:P21
I look for all the president of sex female
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?president ?presidentname ?sexorgender WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P21 ?sex ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . ?sex <http://schema.org/name> ?sexorgender . FILTER REGEX(?sexorgender, "female") } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative: I want to count women out of curiosity
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT count(?president) as ?numero_di_presidenti_donne WHERE { ?president wdt:P39/wdt:P279* wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P21 ?sex ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . ?president <http://schema.org/name> ?presidentname . ?sex <http://schema.org/name> ?sexorgender . FILTER REGEX(?sexorgender, "female") } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative: Now i want to show the presidents female and the their name republic
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?republicountry ?countryname ?prname ?sexorgender WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P21 ?sex ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } ?pr <http://schema.org/name> ?prname . ?sex <http://schema.org/name> ?sexorgender . FILTER REGEX(?sexorgender, "female") } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative: 5.1 What are the top-5 countries for number of presidents? Which countries had the least?
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?countryname ?republicountry (count( distinct ?pr) as ?numpresidents) WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } } ORDER BY desc (?numpresidents) LIMIT 5

search_workflow.narrative:
5.2 For how many presidents we know a date of death in each country?
GET:  wdt:P570 (date death) from above
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?countryname ?republicountry (count( distinct ?pr) as ?numpresidents) WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P570 ?dateofdeath ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } } ORDER BY desc (?numpresidents) LIMIT 10
output: President of the Republic of Guatemala

search_workflow.narrative:
5.3 Which are the professions of different presidents? How many presidents had a specific profession?
GET from above:
occupation --> wdt:P106
Find the number of different professions of different presidents
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT count(?ocname) as ?num WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; wdt:P106 ?oc . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } ?pr <http://schema.org/name> ?prname . ?oc <http://schema.org/name> ?ocname . } LIMIT 200

search_workflow.narrative: Find all the professions of different presidents
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?ocname WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; wdt:P106 ?oc . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } ?pr <http://schema.org/name> ?prname . ?oc <http://schema.org/name> ?ocname . } LIMIT 10

search_workflow.narrative: I find the first 10 profession (ordered by number of president with that profession) and their number of president
search_workflow.query: SELECT DISTINCT ?ocname (count(?pr) as ?numpr) WHERE { ?pr wdt:P39 ?rc ; wdt:P31 wd:Q5 ; wdt:P106 ?oc . { SELECT ?rc ?republicountry ?country ?countryname WHERE { ?rc wdt:P279 wd:Q248577 ; wdt:P17 ?country . ?rc <http://schema.org/name> ?republicountry . ?country <http://schema.org/name> ?countryname . } } ?pr <http://schema.org/name> ?prname . ?oc <http://schema.org/name> ?ocname . } GROUP BY ?ocname ORDER BY DESC (?numpr) LIMIT 10
